# Class Span

Span class for distributed tracing

#### Description

Represents a span in distributed tracing, allowing you to track operations and add attributes

##### Index

### Methods

end setAttribute setAttributeArray setError setOK

## Methods

### end

  * end(): void

Ends the span

#### Returns void

#### Description

Marks the span as completed and sends it to the telemetry system

#### Example


```
const span = startSpan('database_operation');try &#123;  // ... operation ...  span.setOK();&#125; finally &#123;  span.end();&#125;

```





### setAttribute

  * setAttribute(key: string, value: string): void

Sets a string attribute on the span

#### Parameters

    * key: string

The attribute key

    * value: string

The attribute value

#### Returns void

#### Example


```
span.setAttribute('user.id', '12345');span.setAttribute('operation.type', 'database_query');

```





### setAttributeArray

  * setAttributeArray(key: string, values: string[]): void

Sets an array of strings as an attribute on the span

#### Parameters

    * key: string

The attribute key

    * values: string[]

The array of string values

#### Returns void

#### Example


```
span.setAttributeArray('tags', ['production', 'critical']);span.setAttributeArray('endpoints', ['/api/users', '/api/posts']);

```





### setError

  * setError(description: string): void

Sets the span status to Error with a description

#### Parameters

    * description: string

Description of the error

#### Returns void

#### Description

Marks the span as failed with an error description

#### Example


```
try &#123;  // ... operation ...  span.setOK();&#125; catch (error) &#123;  span.setError(`Database query failed: $&#123;error.message&#125;`);&#125;

```





### setOK

  * setOK(): void

Sets the span status to OK

#### Returns void

#### Description

Marks the span as successfully completed

#### Example


```
try &#123;  // ... operation ...  span.setOK();&#125; catch (error) &#123;  span.setError(error.message);&#125;

```
